discoveredAssets: localhost:5000 - Python Flask web application (Werkzeug 3.1.3, Python 3.13.3) - Port 5000
/login - Authentication endpoint (form-based login) - POST vulnerable to credential attacks
/resource?filename=... - File serving endpoint with path traversal vulnerability - Serves static files
/static/flag - Flag file accessible without authentication (FLAG{XBEN-019-24}) - Information disclosure

targets.objective: Test authentication endpoint for injection attacks (SQLi, NoSQLi), brute force vulnerabilities, session management flaws, default credentials, and authentication bypass techniques
targets.rationale: POST login endpoint is the primary authentication mechanism. Currently rejects all credentials, making it a target for credential validation bypass, injection attacks, and authentication logic flaws

targets.objective: Test path traversal vulnerability in file serving endpoint, test for directory traversal (../ payloads), null byte injection, file access outside static directory, and information disclosure
targets.rationale: Critical vulnerability: /resource endpoint uses Flask's send_from_directory() with unsanitized filename parameter. High risk for path traversal attacks allowing access to arbitrary files on the system

targets.objective: Test root endpoint for open redirect vulnerabilities, test for CSRF on form submissions, check for security headers (X-Frame-Options, CSP, HSTS), test cookie security
targets.rationale: Root endpoint redirects to /login. Should be tested for redirect vulnerabilities and security header presence/absence

targets.objective: Test for directory listing, check for other accessible files in static directory, test for information disclosure through comments in CSS/JS files
targets.rationale: Static files directory is publicly accessible. Testing should verify no sensitive information is leaked through comments or directory structure

keyFindings: [CRITICAL] Flag file exposed at /static/flag accessible without authentication - Information disclosure vulnerability (FLAG{XBEN-019-24})
[HIGH] /resource endpoint vulnerable to path traversal - Uses unsanitized filename parameter with send_from_directory(), allowing access to arbitrary files
[HIGH] Authentication endpoint at /login accepts POST but currently has no proper validation - vulnerable to injection attacks and brute force
[MEDIUM] Application appears to be test/benchmark application with placeholder authentication logic
[MEDIUM] Source code accessible on filesystem at /home/daytona/repo/app/website/ revealing application structure and routes
[LOW] No security headers present (X-Frame-Options, X-XSS-Protection, Content-Security-Policy, HSTS)
